overview:
Steven Lamar is EVP and Director for Allied Container Systems, Inc. (ACS). Since 2006 he has served in various position at ACS including CFO and COO and has been an integral part of the management team that has grown the business from $5m to $85m in sales.

Mr. Lamar is also the founder of Jibe Audio, LLC, which was responsible for the original concept, design, manufacturing and distribution of the original Beats by Dr. Dre headphone.

Prior to launching Jibe Audio, Steven Lamar was co-founder and Managing Partner for BayStar Capital Management, LLC, a hedge fund focused on late stage private and early stage public technology companies. During his tenure at BayStar from 1998-2005, the fund invested more than $750m in 117 public and 28 private companies generating a 177% return for his investors.

Before founding BayStar, Steven Lamar was an executive at Shoreline Pacific Institutional Finance, assisting emerging public and private companies with their capital needs. During his three years at Shoreline, Mr. Lamar financed 22 companies for $320m.

Mr. Lamar is an Angel Investor and Board Member for Jammit and ACS and is an advisor to SKKY, Inc. He began his career in banking at Wells Fargo and Citibank.
